details.title: The women who entered temple weren't devotees, they were Maoists: BJP's V Muraleedharan
details.content:
V Muraleedharan,BJP: Y'day,2 women entered #SabarimalaTemple. They weren't devotees. They were Maoists. CPM with selected policemen prepared an action plan and then saw to it that the women go inside the temple. This is a planned conspiracy by Maoists in league with Kerala government and CPM pic.twitter.com/mfZQqu35vv

— ANI (@ANI) January 3, 2019
Police detain two in connection with Wednesday's violence and stone pelting incidents in Pandalam over Sabarimala temple women's entry.

Kerala: Ambulances being used to help stranded passengers at Thiruvananthapuram Central as bus services are affected in the area due to the hartal called by various organisations over #SabarimalaTemple women entry. pic.twitter.com/tURDZgevh5

— ANI (@ANI) January 3, 2019
First shop opens at SM street in Kozhikode as traders, hotels, shop owners choose to defy hartal call.
Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation has stopped its bus operations to Kerala for the day in view of the hartal called by various organisations over # Sabarimala Temple women's entry.
BJP holds protest march in Kochi against the entry of women in Sabarimala temple

Supreme Court refuses to give an urgent hearing to a mentioning by lawyer, PV Dinesh, seeking initiation of contempt proceedings against the #SabarimalaTemple priest for purification of temple premises after entry of 2 women yesterday. SC said the matter has been fixed for Jan 22 pic.twitter.com/HcEZGX7xKZ

— ANI (@ANI) January 3, 2019

details.title: WATCH | First shop opens at SM street in Kozhikode as traders, hotels, shop owners choose to defy hartal call

details.content: A KSRTC bus was attacked by the protesters during a march in Vadakara, Kozhikode

PGS Varma,member of royal Pandalam family,on #Sabarimala women entry issue:Kerala govt is taking measures everyday to send someone there to disturb its rituals. It's festival time when per day 1-2 lakh ppl used to come to temple but due to govt action, it has reduced to 10-15,000 pic.twitter.com/BQy2oo3dSs

— ANI (@ANI) January 3, 2019

details.title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan holds press meet
details.content: "It is government's responsibility to give protection to women. The government has fulfilled this constitutional responsibility. Sangh Parivar is trying to make Sabarimala into a clash zone," says CM Vijayan.
Seven police vehicles, 79 KSRTC buses destroyed & 39 police personnel attacked, so far. Most of the persons attacked were women, including women journalists, says Pinarayi Vijayan

If Tantri does not want to follow Supreme Court order on women's entry into the shrine, he can choose to leave. It is for the devaswom board to decide on whether or not to close the temple: CM Vijayan
Kerala UDF MPs protest outside the parliament house in New Delhi.

Congress MP K Suresh on #Sabarimala women entry issue: We're observing 'black day' in Kerala today. State govt is challenging the sentiments of devotees of #Sabarimala. With the sponsor of state govt, these two young women entered the temple. They are activists, they are maoists pic.twitter.com/jBtMp9wIBt

— ANI (@ANI) January 3, 2019
Traders at Chalai market in Thiruvananthapuram keep shops closed as only two cops were deployed for protection.
BJP protest march at Pathanamthitta
Apart from a few two wheelers, public transport and most of the private vehicles were off the roads in Kerala.

details.title: Asianet cameraperson attacked
details.content:
Trivandrum: Asianet cameraperson Biju attacked by BJP workers during protest over #SabarimalaTemple issue. #Kerala pic.twitter.com/RGemTsBDbz

— ANI (@ANI) January 3, 2019

details.title: Sabarimala tantri can step down if he cannot obey Supreme Court's order: CM Pinarayi Vijayan
details.content: The government is not adamant to take women to the temple but it is bound to obey the Supreme Court verdict and to provide security for the women arriving at the shrine, says Vijayan [READ FULL REPORT HERE]

details.title: Kerala ACP Lalji opened shopping complex at Penta Menaka in Kochi on harthal day

details.content: Three BJP worjers were stabbed at Vadanappilly, Thrissur. BJP Vadanapilly panchayat member Sreejith and Ratheesh were stabbed allegedly by CPM workers. In another separate incident, BJP worker Sujith was stabbed allegedly by SDPI workers.

Tension prevailed at SM street, the major commercial centre in Kozhikode city, after traders went ahead and opened a few shops on Thursday morning defying the hartal call. The move was soon opposed by hartal supporters who pelted stones at the shops and threatened traders.

Four Youth Congress activists have been injured in an alleged case of hit and run involving the pilot vehicle of CM's convoy. It took place near Gorky Bhavan near Bakery Junction in Thiruvananthapuram at around 1.30 pm after the protesters tried to wave the black flag at the Chief Minister.
Five BJP workers were taken into custody at Erumeli in Kottayam district after they issued threat calls to shops that were kept open on the hartal day.

K Muraleedharan MLA who visited the injured Youth Congress workers at the hospital said that it is a deliberate case of hit and run and that the CM is answerable to the same. The Indian National Congress had earlier stated that it will observe a 'black day' on Thursday.
Kottayam Press Club refuses to let SKS chief Sasikala to conduct press meet, condemns her pro-riot Facebook posts.
Kerala journalists boycott state BJP chief Sreedharan Pillai's press meet in Thiruvananthapuram protesting attacks on mediapersons.
Some miscreants hurled a bomb at the police near Nedumangadu in Thiruvananthapuram. No injuries reported.

details.title: Police chief to take action
details.content: Kerala State Police Chief Loknath Behera has directed respective District Police Chiefs to constitute a special team to inquire into the violence against media persons. Behera said that the Intelligence wing has been directed to collect all details regarding such attacks.
Police personnel deployed outside KTDC Rain Drops in Chennai after protests and attacks over two women entering the Sabarimala temple in Kerala. (Photo | Martin Louis/EPS).

details.title: AIDWA condemns purification ritual by Sabarimala priests after women's entry
details.content: The All India Democratic Women's Association has expressed strong objection to the purification rituals carried out by the priests after two women of menstruating age visited the Sabarimala temple. AIDWA has called upon all its units in the country to condemn this regressive stand of the communal forces on January 3, the birth anniversary of social reformer Savitribai Phule.

details.title: Hyderabad-based woman journalist reaches Pamba
details.content: Manorama reports say that Deepthi, a woman journalist has reached Pamba. She has clarified that she wasn't going to enter the shrine and was only doing her job.
READ HERE: 97 hartals in 2018: 'God's Own Country' Kerala brought to its knees

details.title: Kochi traders denounce hartal
details.content: Numerous shops in Kochi have opened during today's hartal. Even trade union leaders approached shops in the city to encourage traders to open their establishments. READ HERE
Better Kochi Response Group has asked residents in Kochi to stand against the hartal on Thursday (File Photo | BP Deepu/EPS)

details.title: BJP worker attacked in Kozhikode
details.content: 46-year-old Anil Kumar attacked, reported Manorama News.

Policemen guard the entrance of Kozhikode's famous SM Street, adorned with a sculpture celebrating S K Pottekkatt's work 'Oru Theruvinte Katha' (The Tale of A Street), which immortalised the iconic avenue. Ironically, violent scenes were witnessed at the street on Thursday when hartal supporters vandalised shops and threatened traders for opening shutters, defying the hartal call. | Express Photo by TP Sooraj.
Kozhikode District Collector Sambasiva Rao visiting SM street where tense situation prevailed after protestors pelted stones at shops during the hartal on Thursday. (Photo | TP Sooraj/EPS)
At least 100 mediapersons have been attacked by Sangh Parivar activists in the last two days. READ HERE:

Kerala: Youth Congress members protesting outside IG office over two women entering #SabarimalaTemple, detained by police in Kochi. pic.twitter.com/Csuoojl0uz

— ANI (@ANI) January 3, 2019
Kerala police have arrested 266 persons and taken 344 into preventive custody so far.

Sought from Chief Minister @CMOKerala an urgent Law and Order report  on the incidents of violence and destruction of private & public property in Kerala following entry of two young women in #Sabarimala temple.
I appeal to all sections of  people to maintain  calm & peace

— Kerala Governor (@KeralaGovernor) January 3, 2019
Kerala Police chief to take action against those behind attacks on media persons. Read full report HERE:

details.title: Violence in Alappuzha
details.content:
Miscreants pelted stones at the CPM office at Poochakkal near Cherthala and destroyed CPM and DYFI flag poles.

KSRTC cancelled all its services from Alappuzha, Cherthala, Kayamkulam and Mavelikkara.

 

Read detailed report HERE:
Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation bus services to Kerala have been resumed. (ANI)

details.title: Visuals of protests from Pathanamthitta

details.content: Till Thursday evening, 745 people have been arrested and 628 were detained. 559 cases have also been registered across the state in connection with hartal violence.
